title: What is the shortest time to get a degree from an online school? - Quora

response.answer_text: The number of credits in a degree is the same regardless of how the courses are delivered. Bachelor’s degrees are about 120 semester hours and master’s degrees around 30–40 credits. This works out to 40 3-credit classes or 10–13 grad classes. The question then is how many credits can be earned in a compressed period. The shortest term I have seen is 5 weeks. That means at 1 course at a time you could earn a bachelor’s degree in 200 weeks or almost 4 years. If you double up, you could get that down to 100 weeks or two years. A master’s program could be done in about a year. In the U.S., all courses have to be the same amount of work regardless of whether they are online or on campus in 15 weeks or 5 weeks. Taking 2 classes in 5 weeks would be intense. The expected workload would be 46 hours of school per week. The alternative option is what is known as competency-based education. Western Governors University uses this model where you are not tied to a course schedule and can go faster if you work harder or know more to start with. I don’t think they will advertise any speed records, though, because that is just asking for complaints for a variety of reasons.

Several ranked schools offer programs that are as short as 12 months but they may require that you have already taken some business fundamental courses. See this list here on length and cost of different online options: Online MBAs: How Much Do They Cost? How Long To Complete? | Poets&Quants
